alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 12:03PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central St. Lawrence County through 100 PM EDT... At 1202 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Oswegatchie, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oswegatchie, Fowler, Star Lake, Fine, Pitcairn, Lower Oswegatchie, Aldrich, Fullerville, Newton Falls, Balmat, Wanakena, and South Edwards. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence
